pullrequest.title: BULLET: Contact points on surface should be processed as well

content.raw:
Hm... Did anything change in the Gazebo Bullet code since Gazebo 7? Default branch using the newest bullet deb package (any newer than 2.83) but presumably this is the same that you used to build the Gazebo 7 you tested with.
Did you try this with the default branch as well? I definitely get this problem on my system. Peculiar the depth is exactly 0, but I was guessing that this is something bullet sets. Can investigate where this is set.

IMO technically a depth of exactly 0 should be counting as contact to send feedback on, unless I'm missing something here. Was there any reason behind sending feedback on contact points with negative depth only?
content.html:
Hm... Did anything change in the Gazebo Bullet code since Gazebo 7? Default branch using the newest bullet deb package (any newer than 2.83) but presumably this is the same that you used to build the Gazebo 7 you tested with. Did you try this with the default branch as well? I definitely get this problem on my system. Peculiar the depth is exactly 0, but I was guessing that this is something bullet sets. Can investigate where this is set.

IMO technically a depth of exactly 0 should be counting as contact to send feedback on, unless I'm missing something here. Was there any reason behind sending feedback on contact points with negative depth only?
